name: Hilton Garden Inn Frankfurt Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew from Philadelphia and had a 7 hour lay over in Frankfurt before continuing on to Croatia. We needed a nap and a shower. Although the hotel was nice and relatively easy to find at Frankfurt airport, I felt that 160 Euros to use a room for 4 to 5 hours was overly expensive.
reviews.title: Day Room Use

reviews.text: This is a typical Hilton Garden Inn with the amenities you would expect to find in the USA. The difference is it is set inside a futuristic building known as the Square. There is a multiple of restaurants and shopping inside the building complex. The airport and mainline train station are a short walk away within the the building. The Hilton Hotel is directly adjacent (I'm not sure why??). The location made getting to an early flight very easy and I was in control and not waiting for a bus. We ate a sushi restaurant on the 2nd floor but wish we had found the deli grocery store on the 1st floor first. Great selection and good prices with seating in the common area. I who return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Only Place to Wait for a Plane

reviews.text: Hilton does a great job catering to the business traveller. This hotel is inside the Frankfurt airport, directly above the long distance train station. I arrived by train in the evening and then flew out the next morning on an early flight to the USA. It was easy to get to and easier to get to my flight.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for a layover at the airport

reviews.text: If you arrive by train, just take one of the elevators directly from the platform to level 5, which is where the HGI entrance is located. Next to the Hilton Hotel. The staff is very friendly and efficient. Many of their customers are travelers either coming from or returning to the USA so they are familiar with the American business traveller.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small, but have everything needed for a short stay. My room had a king bed with a large desk, mini-bar, big TV, and lots of electrical outlets on the desk and at the bedside. The bathroom was well stocked with shampoo, bath gel, conditioner, and bars of soap. It had a large bathtub.
reviews.title: Superb experience

reviews.text: Hotel is new and clean, rooms are decent size. They have free wi fi but it is so slow it hardly connects. My other complaint is that all the TV channels are in German except 5 English speaking news channels. I have previously stayed in the Hilton at the Frankfurt Airport and the rooms are larger and they at least had the travel channel in English...but they did not have free wi-fi (which is not that useful anyway). Beds are comfortable, bathroom nice and functional
reviews.title: Brand new hotel, rooms are nice

reviews.text: You can't beat the location of the Frankfurt airport Hilton. The rooms were well-appointed - not luxurious but very comfortable and clean. The staff were very efficient at check in and out. There was a hotel-wide problem with the internet. We reported it and were pleasantly surprised when a staff member called us to let us know it had been fixed. The fitness room was well-equipped. Our room did not overlook the courtyard, so we had more privacy than those rooms overlooking the courtyard and straight into other rooms.
reviews.title: solid accommodations

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Gardens at Frankfut airport on a recent business trip. Travelling from overseas it was a very convenient circumstance to walk a few hundred meters and be in a clean, confortable room. The communication to Frankfurt using the regional and ICE trains is great. There is an assortment of restaurants, bars and a convenience shop within the New WOrk City, which is the name of the futuristic glass building where the hotel is. Veruy friendly staff, very convenient hotel, reasonable price.
reviews.title: Very convenient, clean, comfortable and afordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This isn't just another airport hotel. The location is perfect for either train or plane travel. When we arrived by train it was just a short ride up to the main floor of The Square and then down to one end and up one more floor to arrive at the Hilton Garden Inn reception desk. The next morning was also easy, back down one floor and then take the connecting walkway over to Terminal 1 at Frankfurt airport. It is about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the departure counters.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As well as the location be very convenient we also had a bed and breakfast package. They have a very good buffet and you can also get fresh eggs made for you in the form of an omelet or fried.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot beat the location being right inside airport terminal one. Check in was very quick. Breakfast was included in the rate. A very good selection including omelets and eggs any style. The room was a nice size. The bathroom was very nice. The beds were the typical Hilton quality EXCELLENT. I would definitely not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect location and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I stayed was relativley small but it was clean and had a good bed. Also the bathroom was good but small. The restaurant offered breakfast only till 10am so we had to go to the airport building. It is an OK Hotel for a quick overnight stay. I would recommend to spend a bit more and stay in the Hilton next door.
reviews.title: Small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started our Germany trip in Frankfort. We spent our last night at the Hilton Garden Inn and it was a perfect ending to our trip. The restaurant was very good and we had the ability to walk through the terminal visiting the various shops. The hotel is very new and modern.
reviews.title: Wonderful peaceful hotel

reviews.text: very good location, modern style, staff american minded, but on problems no real help. Unclear additional fee policy, difficult internet booking and changing reservation only possible by phone call, not at Internet platform
reviews.title: nice, modern new

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located in The Square area of Frankfurt Airport. An easy 10 minute walk from the rental car return area. 5 minutes to the departure gates in Terminal 1. Clean rooms with free WIFI, and comfortable beds. No airplane noise. Good shopping and dining in the Square. There is a Starbucks just outside the door of the hotel. This hotel gives very good value for the money.
reviews.title: Great for airport stay in Frankfurt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for a stop over prior to an early morning flight. Check in was extremely efficient and quick - less than 60 seconds, and the room was spotless, comfortable and modern. We found the walk from arrivals was no where near as long as some have commented on and as it was all under cover, no hardship at all. We would certainly stay here again and would recommend it as a perfect place for a stop over between flights. The only negative I could add was directions to the hotel (or the Squaire) from the arrivals hall were non existent (or hard to find). After asking at the Rail info desk I was advised to follow signs for Long Distance trains and eventually picked up signs for the hotel.
reviews.title: Ideal for a stop-over.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern, clean, friendly staff and super convenient. When I booked this hotel because it was close to the airport, I didn't realize that you would be completely in air conditioned connecting buildings from the moment you stepped off the aircraft. We arrived in Terminal 2 but easily walked to the hotel via the sky train to terminal 1 and followed the signs in about 15 minutes. The train station is about a 2 minute walk from the hotel and all undercover and with a lift to the platform. Very easy to catch express trains as we did to Amsterdam. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes and a supermarket all located in the complex. As we flew in and out of Frankfurt for our European holiday, this hotel was a perfect choice.
reviews.title: Minutes to trains and planes

reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly located at the Frankfurt airport. From terminal 1 (mostly Lufthansa) it is a 5 minutes walk indoors. From the international train station it is two floors up! It is locate at The Squaire (yes, that is how it is spelled, don't know why), which is a huge building with more than six restaurants and many shops. I did not have breakfast at the hotel because there are much cheaper options right outside (still in the same building)
reviews.title: Perfect for Airport stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a typical Hilton Garden Inn, no complaints there. if you prefer something more upscale (and have the money) an actual Hilton is right next door. Between those two and terminal 1 is a Sheraton, also a bit expensive. I have stayed there as well, but from now on i will stay at the Hilton Garden Inn.
reviews.title: Clean and near airport
Convenient and modern...
reviews.text: We stayed the last night of our trip to Germany. Hotel is well located and clean. Nice to drop car off and be within walking distance of airport. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nice business hotel and the location allows you relax either first or last night.

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Frankfurt Airport Hotel
